a.title: A Message From The Class of 2020

div.a: A Message From The Class of 2020

nav.div: Luverne Public School District » News » What's New » Coronavirus Information

strong.span: Message from Superintendent Oftedahl regarding the Coronavirus:

img.p:
We are on our fourth day of distance learning and have been amazed at the work that students, staff, and families have put into making distance learning possible. Despite the many challenges we have had a very positive response to our start to distance learning and are proud of how well everybody has adapted to our new platform for learning. Some highlights of the week are:
• Over 95% of students logged in and were counted in attendance on our first day on Monday
• The district has loaned out over 120 technology devices to families in need
• Our local internet providers have hooked up over 20 families with internet. Thanks to VAST Broadband and Alliance for their support.
• We have over 40 students participating in the daycare for families of healthcare workers
• Each day our number of meals that we are providing has increased. Today we served nearly 300.
As the situation continues to evolve we have had other small changes. Most notably, in cooperation with the city and the county, the school will be closing some areas that are traditionally open to the public. All parks, playgrounds, basketball courts, baseball fields, tracks, and tennis courts are closed due to the governors stay at home order. Thanks for your cooperation.
Also we will be changing our lunch delivery to provide for more social distancing. Families that are picking up lunches will pick them up from a tub at each location. The staff responsible for delivering will be at a safe distance but will not be handing meals directly to those that are picking up.
We will continue to follow our school calendar during distance learning. This will mean that on April 10 there will be no school activities for Easter Break. There will be no meal delivery or daycare on that day either.
We will continue to communicate with students and families from the whole district but as we move further into distance learning much of the information may apply to students at specific schools. Information that we would like to highlight at each school level includes:

The school website has much of information under one link for distance learning. Thanks again for all of your cooperation during this challenging time. Stay home and stay safe!
Craig Oftedahl
Superintendent of Schools
Luverne Public Schools
img.br:
Please see the resources below for information about the disease.

div.p: Luverne Schools will engage students in lifelong learning to achieve their maximum potential in becoming productive citizens.
